segments.en: Linked Discourses 56
5. A Cliff
44. A Bungalow
“Mendicants, suppose someone were to say:

segments.pli: ‘ahaṃ dukkhaṃ ariyasaccaṃ yathābhūtaṃ anabhisamecca … pe … dukkhanirodhagāminiṃ paṭipadaṃ ariyasaccaṃ yathābhūtaṃ anabhisamecca sammā dukkhassantaṃ karissāmī’ti—
segments.en: ‘Without truly comprehending the noble truths of suffering, its origin, its cessation, and the path, I will completely make an end of suffering.’
That is not possible.
It’s as if someone were to say:

segments.pli: ‘ahaṃ kūṭāgārassa heṭṭhimaṃ gharaṃ akaritvā uparimaṃ gharaṃ āropessāmī’ti—
segments.en: ‘Before the lower story of a bungalow is built, I will climb up to the upper story.’
That is not possible.

segments.pli: evameva kho, bhikkhave, yo evaṃ vadeyya:
segments.en: In the same way, suppose someone were to say:

segments.pli: ‘ahaṃ dukkhaṃ ariyasaccaṃ yathābhūtaṃ anabhisamecca … pe … dukkhanirodhagāminiṃ paṭipadaṃ ariyasaccaṃ yathābhūtaṃ anabhisamecca sammā dukkhassantaṃ karissāmī’ti—
segments.en: ‘Without truly comprehending the noble truths of suffering, its origin, its cessation, and the path, I will completely make an end of suffering.’
That is not possible.

segments.pli: Yo ca kho, bhikkhave, evaṃ vadeyya:
segments.en: But suppose someone were to say:

segments.pli: ‘ahaṃ dukkhaṃ ariyasaccaṃ yathābhūtaṃ abhisamecca … pe … dukkhanirodhagāminiṃ paṭipadaṃ ariyasaccaṃ yathābhūtaṃ abhisamecca sammā dukkhassantaṃ karissāmī’ti—
segments.en: ‘After truly comprehending the noble truths of suffering, its origin, its cessation, and the path, I will completely make an end of suffering.’
That is possible.
It’s as if someone were to say:

segments.pli: ‘ahaṃ kūṭāgārassa heṭṭhimaṃ gharaṃ karitvā uparimaṃ gharaṃ āropessāmī’ti—
segments.en: ‘After the lower story of a bungalow is built, I will climb up to the upper story.’
That is possible.

segments.pli: evameva kho, bhikkhave, yo evaṃ vadeyya:
segments.en: In the same way, suppose someone were to say:

segments.pli: ‘ahaṃ dukkhaṃ ariyasaccaṃ yathābhūtaṃ abhisamecca … pe … dukkhanirodhagāminiṃ paṭipadaṃ ariyasaccaṃ yathābhūtaṃ abhisamecca sammā dukkhassantaṃ karissāmī’ti—
segments.en: ‘After truly comprehending the noble truths of suffering, its origin, its cessation, and the path, I will completely make an end of suffering.’
That is possible.

segments.pli: Tasmātiha, bhikkhave, ‘idaṃ dukkhan’ti yogo karaṇīyo … pe … ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti yogo karaṇīyo”ti.
segments.en: That’s why you should practice meditation …”

suttaplex.blurb: Just as it’s impossible to build an upper floor without building the lower floors first, it’s impossible to end suffering without penetrating the four noble truths.
